thread.title_full: How much did the Mets spend on that giant champagne bottle?

author: Steve Politi | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: How much did the Mets spend on that giant champagne bottle?
text:
CHICAGO — There will be certain images frozen in time from the Mets' incredible performance in the National League Championship Series: Daniel Murphy, circling the bases after his latest home run, a fist raised in the air. Jeurys Familia, falling to his knees after recording the final out on the Wrigley infield. And Jeff Wilpon, the son of owner Fred Wilpon and the team COO, guzzling champagne from an enormous bottle that looked like something taken from a cartoon. What in the ... 
NJ Advance Media photographer John Munson captured the moment, and it's been captured in my brain ever since. I have so many questions: How did the Mets get that thing into the tiny Wrigley Field clubhouse in the first place? How much bubbly does it hold? How long did it take before its contents were sprayed/consumed during the wild party? 
And most of all: What does a bottle like that cost? 
Well, from what I can find, prices vary. But it would appear that Wilpon was uncorking an $1,899 bottle of champagne, according to one website that sells the stuff. 
From the description: 
This large format of Taittinger Brut La Française Champagne is "Elegant, distinctive and impeccably crisp, with a spicy bouquet that suggests clove and mint. Stylish, concentrated and tightly focused, this is a classy fizz that extends gracefuuly through an immaculately clean finish." EDITORS' CHOICE. Score: 92, The Wine Enthusiast. 
A Nebuchadnezzar is equal to 20 regular bottles. Due to the oversize bottle, extra shipping charges may occur. You will be notified before we process your order. 
RELATED: Time to give manager Terry Collins credit for this Mets run 
Extra shipping charges? Can you imagine the UPS guy trying to drag that sucker up your steps? He would sue for workman's compensation, or at least demand a glass or 12. 
It looks like a quality champagne despite the size, although apparently, you can also buy it at Costco . Hey, if you're getting 150 rolls of toilet paper (t o, say, take with you to London ), you might as well buy the bubbly in bulk, too. 
You do wonder: If the Mets win the World Series, can they actually find a bigger bottle for that celebration? It's out there, Wilpon . Place your order now. Only $275,000.
